item.title: Dedicated Bandwidth vs Cable
item.description:
Businesses choose dedicated internet services, like T1 lines and Ethernet over Copper, when they prioritize consistent performance and service guarantees, or when shared options aren’t available. Cable broadband, on the other hand, attracts businesses with its high bandwidth for a lower cost. Although cable lacks service guarantees, its proven track record and widespread availability, especially during business hours, make it appealing. The term “dedicated” in this context signifies that a specific bandwidth amount is exclusively allocated to the user...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/dedicated-bandwidth-vs-cable/
